Detailed Description

Timer

SE2 (+ SY and PL) Project SoSe 2011

Milestone 5: OS-Timer

Authors: Rico Flaegel, Tell Mueller-Pettenpohl, Torsten Krane, Jan Quenzel

this class will provide the functionality to execute functions in x milliseconds for Puck_fsm and HALCore objects

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Timer::Timer ( )

Timer

SE2 (+ SY and PL) Project SoSe 2011

Milestone 5: OS-Timer

Authors: Rico Flaegel, Tell Mueller-Pettenpohl, Torsten Krane, Jan Quenzel

This class will provide the functionality to execute functions in x milliseconds for Puck_fsm and HALCore objects

Member Function Documentation

int Timer::addTimerFunction ( CallInterface< CallBackThrower, void > *  funcp,
int  ms,
int  id 
)

adds a functor to internal list and activate Timer

Parameters:
funcpfunctor, the function of HALCore, which will be execute after timer timeout
mstime im milliseconds, after this time the given function will be executed
id- the id of the timer.
Returns:
an int, the id on success, or zero on failure.
int Timer::addTimerFunction ( struct IdTOfunction  new_element,
int  ms 
) [private]

internal function to add functor to list

Parameters:
new_elementthis struct already contains already the given type and functor
mstime im milliseconds, after this time the given function will be executed
Returns:
an integer, the id on success, or zero if it failed.
int Timer::addUnstoppableFunction ( CallInterface< CallBackThrower, void > *  funcp)

add a functionpointer to an internal list. if a stopAll_actualTimer is performed and this functionpointer was found, the Timer of this function will not stop

Returns:
an int, 0 on success, -1 on failure
int Timer::calculateTime ( int  ms,
int *  s,
int *  ns 
) [private]

calculates the seconds and nanoseconds for timer attributes

Parameters:
msmilliseconds, will be splitted into seconds and nanoseconds
sint pointer, into this the seconds will be stored
nsint pointer, into this the nanoseconds will be stored
Returns:
a integer, 0 if action was successful, -1 if not.
int Timer::deleteAllTimer ( )
int Timer::deleteTimer ( int  id)

delete a Timer by a specific internal id

Parameters:
idspecified the timer, which should be stopped
void Timer::execute ( void *  ) [protected, virtual]

to be implemented in the derived class. The application programmer has to write his own loop. He can check bool isStopped() to see if the thread should exit the loop.

Implements thread::HAWThread.

bool Timer::existTimer ( int  id)

checks, if a given ID contains a active timer,

Returns:
a bool, 0 if no Timer is active, 1 if a Timer is active
struct IdTOfunction Timer::find_function ( int  id) [read, private]

internal function to find a specific functor in actual list

Parameters:
idthis is the attribute for searching in list
Returns:
a struct idTOfunction, if the id contains -1, the search was not successful, otherwise successful
int Timer::getnextid ( )

calculates the next id

Returns:
a integer, this is the next free id (not index)
struct timeval Timer::getSystemTime_struct ( ) [read]

get the actual system time in ms usage for compare between 2 times

void Timer::handleNormalMessage ( ) [protected, virtual]

handles all NormalMessages received

Implements Communication.

void Timer::handlePulsMessage ( ) [protected, virtual]

handles all PulsMessages received

Implements Communication.

void Timer::shutdown ( ) [protected, virtual]

this function must be implemented in the derived class. The function is called once after the thread has been stopped.

Implements thread::HAWThread.

int Timer::startAllTimer ( )

restart all actual timer if the list contains active timer, this timers will be ignored

int Timer::stopAll_actual_Timer ( )

stop all active timer after this operation, new timer can be set
